info.name: Salsify API Toolkit v1.5
info.description:
## SALSIFY CONFIDENTIAL
### Updated: 2018-11-19

---

This is a toolkit of API calls to be used in Salsify. 

It is not complete, but includes the most commonly used API calls and arguments for the core platform.

---

### **MAKE SURE THAT YOU CHECK WHAT ORG YOU ARE IN BEFORE MAKING ANY CHANGES**

---

# Environment setup
We recommend splitting superuser environments from customer environments (and potentially keeping a "dummy" environment with information that would be alright to pass on to a customer).

Your environment should include the following [environment variables](https://www.getpostman.com/docs/v6/postman/environments_and_globals/manage_environments):
* `super_org_id` - Change this to the internal (short) org id. The default should be something like `0000`
* `auth` - Your authorization token. This should include `Bearer ` and the default should not be your token
* `isSuperuser` - `true` or `false`. Your Superuser environment should have this set to `true`
* `x-auth-organization-id` - This should be set to `X-AUTH-ORGANIZATION-ID` for superuser environments

---
*Basic Superuser Environment*

![Superuser enironment setup with superuser token](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1fcVKFZIX50sMeERQzAbaMlxlyLz3PYGd)

---
*Sandbox/Customer Environment*

![Sandbox or Customer environment example with org-specific info](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1rOMGDujqWsUm-m2C7WnEiBsIPH5a5uGM)

---
*Dummy Environment (for example generation)*

![Dummy Environment with no org-specific info](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1Aee0QUNudI0KlrM-iBStLQEraj-yJ_mj)

---
# User tokens
This collection assumes you have a superuser API token. If you do not have a superuser API token, read [this page](https://salsify.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/94846159/Superuser+Policy) and then generate a token using the [admin dashboard](https://app.salsify.com/admin/tokens)

When using this toolkit, keep these guidelines in mind:
* Never modify customer data without written permission from that customer
* Whenever possible, access a customer organization as a Salsify employee user not a customer employee user
* Never check in a superuser API token into source control or share it via Slack or email; if you do, invalidate the token using the admin dashboard
* **When in doubt, pause and ask for help; this is not the time for fast not flawless**

API tokens should go in the `auth` environment variable (even for non-superuser environments). Example: `Bearer 1111111111111111111111111111`

# Organization IDs
If you are using this toolkit as a superuser, you can set `super_org_id` to the short, internal org id (e.g. 7773). The pre-request script will automatically get and fill in the system_id in the request URI.

*If you are not a superuser*, you should disable the `X-AUTH-ORGANIZATION-ID` header in your request (it is enabled by default) and provide the org system_id in the `organization_id` variable.

# Changing orgs as a Superuser
To change what org you're working in, change your `super_org_id` environment variable. **This will update all of your requests**, so make sure that you're not working in two orgs at once. If you do need to work in multiple orgs at the same time, change the `X-AUTH-ORGANIZATION-ID` header value directly in each request to ensure that it's authenticated to the correct org.

To change between orgs:
![Changing the `super_org_id` value in the environment menu](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1RgjDNr0YAyd8OGvw_mH6vE3y9PGm65oF)

# Pagination
Most API responses are paginated, with the default page being 30 items. You can change this using the parameters `per_page` (up to a limit of 250) and `page`.

# Workflows/Content Flow Service
Workflows/Content-Flow Service is more fully documented in [this Swagger doc](https://content-flow-service.internal.salsify.com/doc) and is included in this toolkit only as a quick reference.

# Public vs private APIs
Our APIs are divided into `Public`, `Semi-Public`, `Semi-Private`, and `Private`, depending on how we choose to support them, how we announce changes to them, and how computationally expensive they are. 
Many of the APIs documented here are not public. 
Please read the [API Change Process](https://salsify.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/66682890/API+Change+Process) doc. If an API is not listed as "Public", check with Evan, Matt Cross, or CS or Engineering before recommending it to customers.

# Errors? Corrections? Updates? Questions?
This is maintained by Evan Moulson.
Email Evan at [emoulson@salsify.com](mailto:emoulson@salsify.com) or Slack @emoulson

request.description: Supports bulk creation with no param

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Etag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: Via
header.description: Informs the client of proxies through which the response was sent.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-Ratelimit-Limit
header.description: Custom header

header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Request-Id
header.description: Custom header

  "Price MSRP": "49.99",
  "Price Partner": "39"
}

body.raw:
{
  "SalsifyId": "PPG-UL",
  "Name": "PPG ULTRALAST Interior Latex",
  "Category": "Products",
  "Description": "Backed by 135 years of coatings expertise, PPG ULTRALAST Interior Paint + Primer delivers unprecedented washability that sets a new standard for super-premium interior paints. Proprietary CLEAN SURFACE TECHNOLOGY is a powerful integration of automotive and industrial coatings technology that delivers easy removal of stains and scuffs, as well as exceptional resistance to color loss and gloss change  in any sheen and paint color. Choose PPG UltraLast washable interior paint to keep walls looking clean and fresh until it is time to change the paint color. To learn more about this product check out our guide to PPG UltraLast Washable Paint.",
  "Keywords": ["ultralast","fast","interior"],
  "Price MSRP": "49.99",
  "Price Partner": "39"
}

header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: Via
header.description: Informs the client of proxies through which the response was sent.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-Ratelimit-Limit
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Ratelimit-Remaining
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Request-Id
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Runtime
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Xss-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter
